text: Take a few moments to look at yourselfI had posted here recently to essentially vent  because I have struggled for a long time with depression  anxiety and PTSD  and I would say there have been more bad times than good times in my   years of life    But today I realized how little I actually focus on myself  and figured that this probably applies to a lot of the people here   It s easier to focus on things around us and distract ourselves  but at the end of the day  I know that I haven t done much of anything to change my life  I ve just tried to distract myself from feeling like shit   My life isn t going to change if I don t change it  so I ve realized that I need to change    So please take a few moments to look at yourself  it can help

text: I survived and I ve realized my mistake On February  th at around   AM I took around    mg tablets of adderall mixed with   cups of coffee  I have a heart condition that causes an extra electrical pathway to fire when my heart is under stress  which drastically increases the heart rate for short periods of time  I was hoping that this combination of factors would eventually trigger a heart attack  I was transferred to the hospital in an ambulance and after   hours of insomnia due to the stimulant  it was finally balanced in my system and I was medically cleared in the hospital  The Monday after I was transferred to a behavioral hospital in which honestly  I had some of  the worst and most bizarre experiences I ve ever witnessed or been a part of  I realized that out of all my peers  I was the one who was able to handle my emotions without outwardly broadcasting them  I met people that were so fucked mentally I questioned if I belonged there  And after   days and   nights of captivity  they finally released me  I think after seeing how life could be so much shittier and with no possible way to end it  not even suicide  I learned how to endure the mundanity of everyday life and the longing for someone to share my feelings with in confidence until I finally find an opening and some control in the flow of my life
summary: On February th at around AM I took around mg tablets of adderall mixed with cups of coffee. I have a heart condition that causes an extra electrical pathway to fire when my heart is under stress. I was transferred to the hospital in an ambulance and I was medically cleared in the hospital the Monday after. I had some of the worst and most bizarre experiences I ve ever witnessed or been a part of.

text: I have to make an argumentative social media post for my English class and Reddit counts as social media so here ya go  I will legit just take a screenshot of this as proof I posted and promptly forget about it after  Good evening fellow gamers  As I am sure you already know  video games can have a lot of benefits in terms of building relationships and a sense of community  The friendly and harmless banter that arises from such activities is quite special and unique to this enormous community of fellow  gamers  With such unending variety in games  people can build  fight  win  and play as a team  It strengthens bonds and builds entirely new ones because of the time spent together  watching each other succeed and pull off impossible plays  but also watching each other fail miserably  This simple time spent together  through thick and thin  is how lasting friendships are created  and how already existing ones become better  The feeling of clutching a  v  and mopping the floor with an entire enemy team cannot be compared  Positive reinforcement from your peers and a sense of pride can do wonders for self confidence  while taking a loss has few  if any  real consequences  This seems like something other adults and parents have difficulty understanding  The hours spent  doing nothing  or  wasting time  are not just sent down the drain  because the network of people surrounding gaming form a legitimate community  The common elation and rush found in interactive entertainment brings everyone all together and it s how the new generation socializes  and how future ones will  too  Video games are here to stay  and they can bring more good than harm  especially in this time when socializing in person is so difficult
summary: Video games have many benefits in terms of building relationships and a sense of community. Video games are here to stay and they can bring more good than harm in this time when socializing in person is so difficult. The common elation and rush found in interactive entertainment brings everyone together.
